É impressionante o quanto a Valve e a Gearbox ja se importava com os detalhes desde 1999, eu fui usar uma arma elétrica em baixo da água o Shepard morreu na hora, é um nivel de realismo surpreendente pra quando o jogo foi lançado, muito a frente a seu tempo. A interação com os parceiros, as armas criativas, e é legal ver a historia aos olhos de outros personagens que so queriam sobreviver, ta mais facil que o half life 1 devido ao armamento melhor do Shepard com a sniper do hit kill, pra quem joga no hard vai sofrer um pouco ainda mas se vc zerou o hl 1 no hard esse ai é facil com as armas do Shepard, e a nightvision no lugar da lanterna 10/10.
 
VIPER
319 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
7.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 aout 2015
Half-Life: Opposing Force é o primeiro pacote de expansão de Half-Life.
Em Oppossing Force o jogador assume o controle do soldado da HECU Adrian Shepard.

A missão de Adrian, como os outros Fuzileiros, é chegar a Black Mesa e eliminar as provas do acidente. Porém, Adrian nunca teve essa intenção. Acontece que, quando Adrian ia no helicóptero, os Xenianos (os extaterrestres de Half-Life 1) o atacam, fazendo com que Adrian tenha de lutar pela sua vida. Então ele é salvo pelos cientistas e recebe ordens de eliminar Gordon Freeman (por isso ele segue Freeman até o portal).

O jogador conta com um verdadeiro arsenal de armas dos mais variados tipos. O número de armas em Opossing Force chega a atingir o dobro das armas de Half-life 1. Como em Half-life 1, o jogador não tem um "final-feliz". Pelo contrário: no fim do jogo, Adrian é misteriosamente detido. G-man está de volta neste jogo, aparecendo também no final e tendo também uma conversa com Adrian.

 
Lightstruck

Recommandé

Évaluation publiée le 8 janvier 2022
ОЦЕНКА 5

[ПЛЮСЫ]
- Интересный сюжет игры, особенно когда вы воюете вместе с NPC
- Есть русская озвучка, где хорошо побуждают в атмосферу войны с монстрами
- Много разных монстров со своими особенностями боя
- Хорошая оптимизация для слабых ПК

[МИНУСЫ]
- Бывают проблемы что NPC стоит на месте, не идёт за мной

Моя оценка 5 из 5, потому что в игре имеется большое разнообразие, где-то вам надо плыть по воде, где-то быть очень аккуратным и не упасть в пропасть космоса, где-то защищаться от монстров, или во все воевать вместе с NPC против всех и выполнять задания.

Half-Life: Opposing Force - это...
  • Когда нет фонарика.
  • От реализации прибора ночного видения практически потерял зрение. До сих пор плохо различаю объекты.
  • Чересчур нелепая новая раса. Какие-то петухи и крабы.
  • Слишком много ползания по трубам и вентиляции.
  • Тупейший спавн врагов.
  • Просто скучно.
Итог: Как-то в отличии от Blue Shift этот аддон не зашел.

39.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2014
Whee... nostalgia.

A spin-off game of the original Half-life made by Gearbox, now better known as the buggers who make the Borderlands games. Instead of playing as the nerd Gordan Freeman, you instead play as one of the lunkhead Marines that you had to fight in the original game. Yey.

So what does this change? Not too much. You get options to control some other soldiers at times who help you open doors, heal you, and of course shoot aliens. There are also plenty of new weapons, several of which are rather awesome like the M249 SAW... or whatever it's called. It's a light machine gun, ok? Beyond these little things, there's little to differentiate the game from the original Half-Life, except that you fight far more aliens than humans. And that some of those new aliens are rather nasty.

Well, it's also shorter. Alot shorter. I cleaned this out in just under 4 hours, though I had the benefit of past memory that seemed to instantly remember exactly how to get through everything despite not having played this in a decade.

Anyway, it's a little extra Half-Life funtimes. Might as well play it if you liked the original game. :o
 
Yureina

Évaluation publiée le 20 février 2016
>>> Проверено! Игрушка полноценно поддерживает разрешение экрана 1920*1200;
>>> Проверено! Игрушка идет на Win 10;

Офигенный аддон для легендарной игры, ставший "неканоном" из-за не в меру богатой фантазии Gearbox. Понимаете ли разрабы добавили слишком много отсебятины (новое оружие, новые противники, новые подробности раскрывающие вселенную, а так же целая новая раса!), из-за чего "красавчик Гейб" постскриптум принял волевое решение происходящее в аддоне за канон не считать. Однако несмотря на неканоничность играть в это нужно, потому что это все тот же Half-life, только лучше и разнообразней.

ПОЧЕМУ НУЖНО ИГРАТЬ?
- новые враги;
- новые-старые уровни;
- новое огнестрельное оружие (черный Desert Eagle, снайперская винтовка и др.);
- новое органическое оружие (с аппетитом кушает боеприпасы и стреляет при почесывании брюшка);
- от людей, которые впоследствии сделали Borderlands (это чувствуется);

Итог: уверенно рекомендую. Солидная продолжительность, но без нудятины, большое количество нового контента. Именно такими и должны быть аддоны.

Half-Life: Opposing Force
Ďalšie rozšírenie staručičkého Half-Life prináša nový pohľad na udalosti v Black Mesa z pohľadu armády. Opposing Force príbehovo trochu zaostáva za primárnou hrou, ale je jej dobrým následovníkom. Grafika primeraná veku vzniku a ovládateľnosť s fyzikou generačne na úplne inej úrovni. Pre hráčov, ktorým nevadia staré hry, môžem len a len odporúčať.

Achievement hunteri: Škoda, ale ani po tých rokoch nepridané.
Pomer cena a zábava: Herný zážitok primeraný cene.
Celkový dojem z hry: ★★★★/5.

148.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 aout 2019
Arguably vastly superior to the original in all aspects, bar length, Back in the bronze age, this was known as a challenging game. In >current year, I'd not be surprised if the average gamer finds it very difficult. Unlike HL, this game focuses on combat (you're a HECU marine sent in to 'silence' the facility and all associated assets) and, though primitive, things like taking cover behind terrain, baiting enemies with grenades, scoring fat gibs with the handful of satchels the game gives you, and using your advanced AI (for the late 90s) squad members properly is satisfying, and a reward all of its own, not to mention the huge selection of new weapons that augment the arsenal.

The theme of the game, for those who are interested in such things, is 'survival at all costs.'

The game's fairly stingy with supplies, but early into the game, you're given a special weapon that's all-but useless for offensive purposes, but teleports you to hazardous breather locations, as it were, where supplies, healing ponds, and so on, may be found - however, ammunition for this weapon is extremely limited, so you'll at most be using it once per level.

I played this when it came out, almost 20 years ago, and it still holds up today - though you'll want to set a more modern resolution, and tune the uber dark environments to accommodate 20 years of monitor technology and progress. About 8000k to 9300k monitor temperature should do the trick, then adjust the actual contrast, and you'll be fragging like it's the 90s.

Highly recommended. One of my favorite oldschool shooters. It was then, it is now, and likely forever will be. If you're skimping out on this one, you're doing yourself a great disservice.
 
Vassago Rain

Évaluation publiée le 2 juillet 2016
Pros:
- Familiar environments, different gameplay
- Actually new content for an expansion!
- A great twist on Half-Life's campaign
- A much more satisfying final boss

♥♥♥♥:
- Some outdated game mechanics
Much like Half-Life, this game didn't age well. It did significantly better, however
- Boss fights
Much like Half-Life, this game struggles to give a satisfying end to boss fights. They're still challenging and fair, however.
- Short
This is to be expected of an expansion. You get so involved that it ends before you know it.

9/10
It suffers from similar issues as the original Half-Life, but is a very welcome addition to the franchise. A must-have for fans of the series.
 
Merci?

Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 juin 2019
Whatever happened to Shepard?

PROS: The game has all the polish and finesse of the original Half-Life. If you enjoy the combat that came with it, this is a much better title, with fewer puzzles, less platforming, but more gun play. The soundtrack still kicks in at some solid moments, providing tension to amp up the moment.

♥♥♥♥: If you didn't like the combat in Half-Life, then this is not going to sell you on it. It's mostly combat, and the problem comes about with a lot of small hallways. This gives little room to dodge incoming fire.

FINAL: This is a nice little supplement to the original Half-Life story, weighed down only by it's questionable canon nature due to no consequence of the finale. A fun game for old school FPS fans, but completely unneeded for the broader Half-Life story.

Nebulous Idea
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
10.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 décembre 2014
Opposing the Forces

Half life, which I used to pass the time again and again, is still my favorite FPS game. There are many reasons for that (including countless LAN parties in my teenage years), but the thing is, only recently, and thanks to my friend who bought me HL pack, I've discovered that apart from Blue Shift, (which I personaly call The Blue Sh*t) there has been another expansion. This time more interesting, since we get to see the Black Mesa events from perspective of a Solider. After beating the game, I decided to share my thoughts on it.

1. The Lord is our Shephard. - The main character, the idea of the game

Shephard. Well that's basically who our protagonist is, just like in the first HL, we play the part of the people's hero, leading the frightened flock through the dangers of the warzone that the Black Mesa compound has become. Groups of two, three soliders can be found scattered along the whole game. I think it's a good idea to view the original HL story from a different perspective. The point of view is the key here, for it gives greater insight to certain things, like:
- Humanizing the Grunts, whom, in the first HL we understandably percive as an evil force, not very much different from the aliens from Xen. Here, we realise they are just pawns, placed in a similar position to the BM personnel.
- Outside of Black Mesa, we get to see what happens on a larger scale, exploring the military grounds.
- We revisit certain places, like the laboratory in which Freeman teleports to Xen, and get to see what happens then.
The entire storyline follows in the wake of Gordon Freeman, so it has a nice feeling to it, for the players who enjoyed the plot of the original game.

2. Panta Rhei - What's different from the original HL

I must say I'm not a fan of the changes to the armory, or for that matter, to the way we can fight here. Some of the weapon options recived a failry mirrored replacement, like the Colt Python. Some, in fact about a half, remained unchanged - Glock 9mm, the HK MP5, Spas-12, and RPG. The new weapons include three alien biological weapons, which are very ammo efficient since each of them posesses a way of replenishing the ammunition indefinitely. I don't like their concepts however, since for me, they don't serve any purpose in expanding our combat possibilities (except for the melee weapon, but it's nearly impossible to use in serious combat, due to it's nature).
I don't understand the replacement of the crowbar. It has been devided into two weapons - Pipe Wrench, which has 2 attack modes (a normal hit and a loaded attack which takes 3 seconds to fully load) and a knife, quick and low damage/range weapon. For me, the crowbar was perfect. After getting the glock I barely even used the wrench, since there is plenty of 9mm ammo everywhere, despite playing on Hard difficulty. The explosives remain unchanged. We get the granades, Laser Tripmines and Satchel Charges. More new weapons include Sniper Rifle, Heavy Machinegun or an experimental Displacer Cannon.
Casual, Casual.. ehh. C'mon, the three best weapons of the series, being (in my humble opinion) The Crowbar, The Crossbow and The Gauss Riffle, are gone. What fun is there in slashing Xen'ians with a regular knife?
The enemies are also different, considerably tougher and more challanging than in the first HL, altough less fun in my opinion. We hardly see any zombies or headcrabs. We mostly battle organised Xen soliders and their.. warmachines?

3. Nihil novi sub sole - So what is this game all about

It's Half Life. Reskinned, rearranged, rewritten. But it's all the same. The ideas were eaten, chewed and spat out in a mixture of green paint. I like the game, I really do. It's just - we don't do anything new (oh ok except for using a rope two times). Literally. It's all crawling through the pipes, trying to figure out how to get out of old storage-like places, fighting, jumping. There is no new element. We don't even have a chance, despite being a Corporal, to actually implement this element, for commanding people or anything. We just run around exactly like Gordon did, and fight a war we don't understand. there is one thing worthy of mentioning here though - The game passes on, and even expands the element which is one of the reasons for my deep affection for the first HL, this being the nessecity of strategic usage of the enviorment. There are situations and places in which you have to actually figure out what to do. In most of today's games you are given a minimap that shows you where to go. These games explain, step by step, what button to touch and what wire to cut. In this series you've got to rely on your instinct, and that's awesome.

4. Leave a light on for me - More about concepts, changes and the game

Am I the only person who hates the night vision? Man, it's such a terrible concept. I understand that we play a solider and military has to possess some high tech, but damn. You (or at least I) can hardly even see anything in this green light, even in the dark. I'd like a regular flashlight instead, please. What's the deal - couldn't they just leave the flashlight AND add the night vision? If they could implement 3 melee weapons, why not 2 light variants? I know not. Besides, there are like 3 or 4 places in the game where it actually comes in handy. Let's say HL has way more to do with a solid horror climate, where you had to use the flashlight actually more than the pistol and the battery was almost always red. The game is too long. Most of the locations are artificially stretched by repetition. In my opinion the game could be reduced to the 60% of its current length and still have the same, if not the better impact. By the way - there are hardly any bosses here, the ones that do exist are reused HL 1 bosses or boss ideas. Sad. Also, what the hell is with this Displacer Cannon's secondary fire mode? So we can basically teleport to safety at any moment we just need ammo. Did I mention that I hated the Night Vision?

5. Too much love will kill you - my final opinion

The game is decent, overall. It lacks some elements of the original HL atmosphere, which made it a hit, but perhaps it was meant to be this way. Despite playing as a solider I almost haven't felt the military spirit in the process, except for some parts when the combat music carried us. As I mentioned earlier the action is stretched like granny's breasts. There were moments where I've felt like I was meeting some kind of a Force Opposing my completion of the level. Oh, lest I forget - my ultimate complaint. The game was way too easy. Playing on the Hard difficulty, through the most of the game, save for perhaps two last chapters, I was running around will full health... and armor. For old HL veterans this must sound like a blasphemy since HEV armor was hard to come by in HL 1. There are also way too many medpacks in this game. Well perhaps I am tainted with my multiplayer experience. Anyways, I recommend this game, adding 0.5 to my original score, for the sentiment towards the series.

Half Life: Opposing Force - 6.5 / 10

Proxym 2014
 
Proxym
0

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Recommandé
6.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 janvier 2022
WHAT IS YOUR MAJOR MALFUNCTION, MAGGOT!?

Half-Life: Opposing Force is the first expansion pack for Half-Life, developed by Gear Box before Randy got all weird and sleazy on everyone. Or he always was, I don’t know dude looks like he goes to trucker strip clubs.

You play as Adrian Shepard, US marine and part of the Special Forces HECU unit, developed and trained to fight in hazardous environments but also shoot nerds. Adrian’s helicopter is shot down en route to Black Mesa and he falls unconscious. After being saved by the NERDS, Adrian is tasked with linking up with his unit, finding King Nerd Gordon Freeman, putting a bullet in him, and then getting out of Black Mesa before things get worse.

Opposing Force was that expansion pack everyone as a kid wanted to play because it had the cool soldier guy on the cover. But other than that, Half Life: Other Guys does things semi different from the original release.

For one you have new weapons, like the Desert Eagle, Sniper Rifle, a big ass Wrench, and a knife which is basically just a reskinned crowbar. Other than that you get some alien weapons to play with, I don’t want to spoil too much in case you, somehow, have never played OF, so I’ll just say Barnacle Grappling Hook and leave it at that.

Outside of new weapons, you also get to team up with the Marine guys you were wasting in the original Half Life. But instead of just being dudes with guns, they come in several delicious flavors. I don’t know what they’re actually called so just bare with me.
Heavy Gunners are big bastards carrying SAWs, they’re surprisingly good at wasting aliens and can hold their own in a lot of ranged engagements as well.
Engineers carry pistols and are used to unweld doors and smoke cigarettes.
Medics can heal you, but also help fix injured soldiers in your squad.

If I told you OF was kind of a squad shooter you probably wouldn’t believe me. And then call me mean names. Or take my jokes out of context and think I’m being completely seriously like in my other reviews.
I don’t like you, you’re mean to me.

It should only take you about four or five hours to get through the campaign, in which you get to visit areas across Black Mesa that you didn’t get to see in the original game. You also get to contend with new enemies like Alien X or race X or whatever they were called. They’re cool too, but I doubt they’re actually canon. If that even matters.

This is also the game to first introduce Otis, the lovable security guard that can completely waste you in 2 or 3 shots. He’s cool to have around and good in a fight, I like Otis.
Because Otis is NICE to me.

Opposing Force is pretty good. If I had to recommend one of the expansion packs over the other I would absolutely recommend Opposing Force over Blue Shift. The multiplayer is also some what active as well, at least when I played I found a few people booling around in Deathmatch. I also played it for a bit with some friends, its just mindless deathmatch fun. There’s probably someone who’s good at it but they can’t reach me in my doom fortress.

Half Life: The One with the Soldier Guy gets 8 forgotten USB sticks at Medieval Times out of 10.

Ketchup was sold in the 1830s as medicine.

Join the curator or the Drill Instructor will yell at me again.
 
Dirk Dickbutt
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé

半条命质量很高的一部资料片，希望未来有一天还能见到谢泼德下士！

gilbert the gluttenous
338 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2019
So I finished the first Half Life last summer and found it to be a pretty great game albeit with a few fairly big flaws. It's expansion, Opposing Force, unfortunately has these exact same flaws so it's disappointing nothing was improved upon here. The first problem is that there are several sections where the difficult spikes to an insane degree, placing you in rooms with no escape surrounded by way too many enemies, many of whom are complete bullet sponges that only serve to eat up your ammo. There were several points in the game that were just exhausting to play through, as I was constantly save scumming and searching every nook and cranny desperately for just one measly med pack. Another problem in this game, like the previous entry, is that the level design can get quite confusing at times and forces you to backtrack fairly often. This is made even worse in this game by the fact that in certain sections you have a squad that you must direct through the hallways and corridors in order to advance to the next section. I'll just say that the path-finding AI was still very primitive for it's time and these sections probably should have been skipped all together. By far the worst flaw however is the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ platforming. My god has the platforming not aged well with these games at all. There is no weight to your character and you feel like you're floating on a pocket of air or sliding on ice pretty much the whole game. Sounds like the perfect physics system to include platforming doesn't it? I was almost driven to tears in the original Half Life due to platforming ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ rearing its ugly head in the final boss fight. Thankfully, the final boss in this game is not nearly as hair pulling, but there are still several ugly sections that require death after death until you nail the jump just right.

Now to what I enjoyed. The combat in this game is still top notch and the tension is incredibly high. There are no slow moments in this game and no chance to breathe, it's an action packed thrill ride from start to finish. I'm not sure if this is one of the first games to do the multiple perspectives on an event thing (I know Resident Evil 2 did this a year earlier), but it does it well and you really feel like complete hell and chaos is happening around you through radio broadcasts and several in game cut-scenes. The game itself starts about one hour or so before the end of the original Half Life and greatly expands on the lore of the world, adding many new weapons and enemies to keep the experience fresh. Only real complaint about the story I can come up with is that I thought the build up to the final boss was quite weak. In the original you go through a ton of ♥♥♥♥ to finally get to the creature who opened the portal in the first place and it's built up as this huge powerful entity that isn't to be ♥♥♥♥♥♥ with. In this game you just suddenly find yourself in an ammo supply room and are told "something big is coming". It felt pretty underwhelming.

Overall it was a pretty positive experience with the same flaws as the original game. I definitely enjoyed my time with it and look forward to the next expansion, Blue Shift, to finish out the trilogy
 
Deadguy
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.9 h en tout

Recommandé
5.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 juin 2019
Лучшее дополнение сюжета для оригинальной Half-Life.
Blue Shift и Decay даже нет смысла сравнивать с Opossing Force.

Основными положительными сторонами игры являются:

- Сюжет ( Теперь мы играем не за привычного нам "ученого" или какого-то "охранника" , а оперативника подразделения HECU - Адриана Шепарда, фамилия которого уже говорит о том что он не так прост , совершенно другая сторона участвующая в событиях исследовательского центра Black Mesa)

- Новые механики ( Возможность лазать по тросам)

- Новые противники ( Это вам не Вортигонтов , Барнаклов , Хедкрабов убивать , а новую расу Х и следовательно нового босса)

- Новое вооружения ( Теперь вместо монтировки мы используем разводной ключ)
 
Pay2Win
119 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2017
In Half Life: Opposing Force you play as Adrian Sheperd, a man part of the "opposing force" in Half Life, rather than playing as Gordon Freeman.

I like playing as Adrian Sheperd as his perspective of the Black Mesa incident is interesting. The new weapons introduced in the game were a great addition and I also liked the night vision goggles. In Half Life I found myself having to look at a guide at some bits in the game as I wouldn't know what to do or where to go next but I didn't find that problem in Half Life: Opposing Force.

The game was a bit short however, but that's to be expected as originally this game was an expansion to Half Life. I also found the storyline to be very straightfoward and not as compelling to Half Life's story. Although I did like the ending to Half Life Opposing Force and would like to see what the G-Man does with Adrian Sheperd in a future Half Life game (if another Half Life even comes out)

Overall I'd give this game a solid 8/10

Also there's an epic Full Metal Jacket reference
 
EvilFootSniffer

378 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2023
Never reviewed a game on Steam, but I had to speak against the consensus on this one. HL1 is still a great game and mostly holds up today, but this outsourced (heh) expansion does not.

I will probably play it to completion but my qualms so far are:

1. Environments are drab and boring: you're constantly wandering around a grey corridor listening to the same 1-second clip of electricity crackling. Very poor sense of atmosphere.

2. "Puzzles" are both cryptic and mind-numbing: often-times the solution to clearing a room is simply waiting for a scripted event to finish.

3. Horrible jump vertical: you need to crouch-jump to overcome a milk carton. Surely a soldier is more athletic than this? I know crouch-jump is in the original, but this game makes you jump on boxes constantly.

4. Feels like a chore to play: I'm not given any motive except getting out of the aforementioned boring environments.

5. I HATE the wrench.

Positives:

1. New enemies are sort of cool.

2. The knife is fun, but it's not our beloved crowbar.

Overall I would not recommend this Gearbox take on HL1, it feels very much a bootleg of the original rather than something which "expands" it.
 
vatha
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2023
Хороший аддон дополняющий сюжетную линию событий в Black Mesa. Но играть за солдата слишком уж просто. С появлением "no clip"-электропушки, проблема с боеприпасами решается с гарантией до конца игры. Противники постоянно норовят спрятаться за каким-нибудь углом, выставив полкорпуса наружу и гибнут пачками. Последний босс является бледной тенью аналогичного оппонента Фримена, кальмар даже помогает ГГ выпилить себя обратно в иную реальность. Самый большой минус геймплея по отношению к оригинальной компании - почти полное отсутствие нестандартного прохождения уровней, когда для выхода нужно использовать местный ландшафт. А так игра хорошая, играть интересно.
 
Gamer
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
311.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 novembre 2020
[ALERTA DE SPOILERS]

Es una pena los problemas legales que existieron entre GearBox y VALVe. Gearbox realmente logró captar la esencia de Half-Life y ello hace que esta expansión oficial sea digno de dicho título. Es imposible mirar hacia Half-Life sin rememorar Opposing Force.

Aunque sólo expone el papel de los comandos negros en Black Mesa de forma magistral, Las nuevas armas y los nuevos enemigos siempre hacen que me emocione al ponerme a disfrutar de nuevo de esta experiencia que es jugar Opposing Force.

Lo único malo de este juego es que aparte de mods ♥♥♥ licencia e historias inventadas por la comunidad, nunca sabremos realmente lo que le pasó a Shephard... Al menos hasta donde sé.

Pero nunca será olvidado. Aunque en Half-Life 2 quizás lo mencionen de forma discreta y poco esperanzadora. Siempre lo imaginaré en el V-22 en un resignado silencio eterno.
 
Turambar
47 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 janvier 2023
Expansión de Hal-Life que te pone en la piel de un militar en Balck Mesa. Esta expansión no solo te da el punto de vista de los militares ♥♥♥ respecto a la catástrofe sino que también incluye nuevas armas y nuevos enemigos provenientes de una segunda invasión. Es una expansión que al principio le cuesta arrancar pero después se disfruta. Si te gusto el juego base esta expansión también lo hará
 
Mortdecai3
112 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
13.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 juin 2021
Half-Life Opposing Force çok keyifli bir eklenti. Bu eklenti Half-Life'taki birtakım soru işaretlerini giderdiği gibi beraberinde bazı yenilikleri de getiriyor. Oyunun hikayesi Half-Life ile aynı zaman diliminde geçiyor, hatta bir bölümde Gordon Freeman'ı da görme şansı (Oyuncu hızlı olduğu takdirde Gordon Freeman'ı öldürebiliyor.) yakalıyoruz. Hikayede Half-Life'ta karşımıza çıkan ve Black Mesa çalışanları ile uzaylıları öldürmekle görevli "HECU" (Hazardous Environment Combat Unit) askeri ekibinden Adrian Shephard isimli onbaşıyı kontrol ediyoruz. Oyunun başlangıcında Shephard, ekibi ile helikopterdeyken helikopterin düşmesi ile bayılır. Gözlerini açtığında Shephard kendini Black Mesa'da bulur, durumu ise kendisini kurtaran bilim adamından öğrenir. Shephard'ın aşması gereken tek engel uzaylılar değildir, çünkü HECU'nun durumu kontrol altına alamadığını gözlemleyen hükümet, askerleri Black Mesa'dan geri çeker ve işleri yoluna koymaları için Black Mesa'ya özel eğitimli infazcılar gönderir, bu infazcıların görevi Black Mesa'daki her türlü canlıyı (orada kalan askerler ve bilim adamları da dahil) etkisiz hale getirmektir. Bu noktadan sonra Shephard, yer yer yalnız ilerleyerek yer yer Black Mesa'da karşılaştığı diğer askerlerden/bilim adamlarından yardım alarak oradan kurtulmaya çalışır. Hikayenin sonunda Shephard, Xen gezegeninden gelen oldukça güçlü bir yaratığı alt eder ve sonra karşısında G-Man'i bulur. G-Man Shephard'a Black Mesa'nın bir "utanç" olduğunu ve "şu an kendi kendisi ile ilgilendiğini" söyler, G-Man bunu söyledikten sonra Black Mesa'yı yok eden patlamanın sesi gelir. Ardından Shephard'ı kastederek "bazı tanıklar olduğunu" ve onu korumak konusunda kararsız kaldığını, her ne kadar Shephard gibi bir devlet görevlisinin gizliliğin öneminin farkında olduğunu bilse de "işverenlerinin güvenen kişiler olmadığını" söyler. Daha sonra G-Man, Shephard'ı "kimseye zarar veremeyeceği ve kimsenin de ona zarar veremeyeceği bir yere göndermeye karar verdiklerini" söyleyip, onu uzayda bir yere hapseder ve hikaye sonlanır. Opposing Force bir eklenti olmasına rağmen Half-Life'taki soru işaretlerine çok güzel bir şekilde açıklık getiriyor, ayrıca Black Mesa faciasına Half-Life'taki düşmanlarımızdan olan HECU ekibinin üyelerinden birinin gözünden de tanıklık etmiş oluyoruz. Ek olarak hikaye sunumunun da Half-Life'a göre biraz daha geliştirilmiş olduğunu düşünüyorum. Mesela bir yerde özel infazcılar kamyonetlerinden silahlarını indirirken birbirlerine "neden HECU askerlerin becerisizliklerinin cezasını biz çekiyoruz" tarzında yakındıklarını ve oraya geliş sebeplerini açıkladıklarını görüyoruz. Buna benzer birkaç kısım daha eklentide bulunuyor. Half-Life'ta bunlar yoktu, varsa bile daha azdı diye hatırlıyorum. Hikaye sunumunun kötü yanlarından birisi ise ana karakterinin sesinin ve kişiliğinin yine olmaması. Oynanış olarak da yenilikler yapılmış, yeni düşman ve silah çeşitleri eklenmiş ve sadece 1-2 tane değiller. Eklentiyi oynarken Half-Life'ta görmediğim birçok uzaylı düşman çeşidi ile karşılaştım, ayrıca portal atan bir silah ve ağır makineli tüfek gibi yeni eklenen silahlar da bulunuyor, Half-Life'ın bile düşman ve silah çeşitliliği konusunda oldukça iyi olduğunu göz önünde bulundurursak, daha fazla çeşitlilik eklemek Opposing Force'u çok başarılı kılmış. Kontroller Half-Life'taki gibi zaman zaman sinir bozucu olabiliyor, yine de bunun çok büyük bir sorun olduğunu söyleyemem. Bölüm tasarımı olarak eklenti aynı Half-Life gibi çeşitli ve eğlenceli, sürekli aynı atmosfer olmadığı gibi tasarımlar sıkıcı da değil. Grafiksel olarak pek bir gelişme yok, performans olarak Half-Life gibi stabil. Oynadığım süre boyunca herhangi bir hata ile de karşılaşmadım. Half-Life Opposing Force, Half-Life'ı sevenler için biçilmiş kaftan.
 
YRD

Recommandé
6.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mars 2021
Half-Life: Opposing Force
Дополнение к основной игре показывает инцидент на чёрной мезе от лица солдата HECU
Пулемётчик HECU a écrit :
Так, куда мы летим? Капитан, кажется, говорил что-то про «Чёрную Мезу» или что-то типа этого..

Сюжет
Главный герой Адриан Шепард один из бойцов спецподразделения HECU который был направлен для зачистки 
Чёрной мезы, но попадает в передрягу с пришельцами его спасает один из ученых Чёрной мезы

Графика
Такая Же, как и в первой части 

Геймплей
На любителя

Мультиплеер
К сожалению мультиплеер умирает 

Мое мнение
В сравнение с первой частью изменилось только три вещи персонаж, о ружье, противники кроме чёрных оперативников. Вам дают моральный выбор убивать ученых и охранников чёрной мезы или же нет . Как по мне дополнение хорошее и стоит поиграть ставлю игре 10 из 10
Спасибо, что прочитали мой обзор приятной игры

G-Man a écrit :
Итак… Капрал Шепард, вот мы и встретились.

Vidéo YouTube™: Half-Life: Opposing Force [Music] - Tunnel 
Vues : 211,536
http://www.gamespot.com/pc/action/halflifeopposingforce/index.html

Évaluation publiée le 19 septembre 2022
Este juego o expansión me entretiene pero tiene cosas que son malas objetivamente, como los diseños de algunos enemigos, lo desperdiciado que esta la pistola de teletrasportacion (que solo sirve para lootear) y el barnacle (solo lo aprovecharon en 2 ocasiones), tiene un jefe final pésimo y un final anticlimactico porque no se escucha lo que dice G-man por el helicoptero xd, pero me parece más entretenido y divertido que Blue Shift, decidieron arriesgarse agregando nuevo contenido en lugar de Blue Shift que decidieron usar el contenido de Half-life 1 sin agregar nada nuevo, Opposing Force tiene cosas que no puedo defender pero aun asi disfrute el juego, lo recomiendo.

Recommandé
24.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 aout 2022
Una gran expansión para un gran juego. Opossing Force nos muestra la otra cara de la moneda respecto a los incidentes ocurridos en las instalaciones del Black Mesa.
En este caso nos pondremos en los zapatos de Adrian Shephard. Un joven militar de 22 años de edad cuyo objetivo es averiguar que ocurre en dichas instalaciones aparte de atrapar a Gordon Freeman. En esta entrega encontraremos nuevas armas y enemigos los cuales son de una raza diferente a los Xenianos. "La raza X".
Siento que esta fue una gran expansión para un juegazo como Half Life aunque me haya gustado más Half Life Blue Shift no le quito ningún merito a esta joyita. Sin a lugar a dudas lo recomiendo.

Évaluation publiée le 28 décembre 2019
Half-Life: Opposing Force... Half Life Serisinin En Güzel Oyunlarından 1 Tanesi, Oyunda HECU Askeri Olan Corporal Adrian Shepherd İle Oynuyoruz Ve Hem Askeri Tarafı Görüyoruz Hemde X Irkını Görüyoruz, Oyunda ki Silah Çeşitleri Arttırılmış Ve Bu Güzel Olmuş Ve Oyunda ki En Güzel Bölüm Bana Göre Black Ops Askerleri İle Kapıştığımız Bölümdü, Ve Bu DLC İle Beraber Black Mesa'nın Nasıl Yok Olduğunu Öğrenebiliyoruz, Mükemmel Bir DLC Fakat Tek Bir Sorunu Var... Boss Savaşları, Oyunda 2 Tane Boss Var Ve İlk Boss'u Öldürmek İçin Ebesinin Örekesine Gidiyorsunuz, Sonra Boss'u 20 Saniyede Eritip Yeniyorsunuz, Son Boss İle de Sürekli Aynı Şeyleri Yaparak Kapışıyorsunuz, Ama En Azında Blue Shift Gibi Sıkıcı Olmuyor.
 
SHeDoWnFallEn

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 janvier 2019
Sin duda alguna, un gran juego que merece la pena jugar.
Encarnas el papel de Adrian Sheppard, tomando la perspectiva del ejército, quienes son enemigos de Gordon Freeman en la entrega de Half Life original. Una buena expansión que nos trae nuevas armas y enemigos, enemigos que te harán pasar un mal rato (recomiendo pasárselo en modo difícil ;). A pesar de ser un juego corto, este punto de vista de lo sucedido en Black Mesa, añade elementos importantes en la historia de estos juegos. Además, tiene un soundtrack bastante notable.
Muy recomendado.

(λ) Half-Life: Opposing Force (λ)

Daиi™
1,816 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 janvier 2017
Half-Life: Opposing Force

Pontos Positivos

+ Adiciona uma visão alternativa á história do jogo principal que é muito bem executada
+ Adiciona uma quantidade relativamente grande de novas armas e inimigos.
+ Ambientes ótimos e únicos, tanto os que reaparecem do jogo original, quanto os novos.
+ Trilha sonora boa.
+ Campanha de bom tamanho (em torno de 6 horas).

Pontos Negativos

- Extremamente difícil, sendo injusto as vezes. Zerar esse jogo no hard é extremamente frustrante, e não posso dizer que vale a pena. É recomendado jogar no easy (sério).
- O jogo da crash e corrompe seu save com uma certa frequência, mas o auto-save costuma te salvar.

Half-Life: Opposing Force recebe a nota 8.5/10

Se você gostou de Half-Life, é praticamente uma obrigação você jogar essa expansão, se o preço parecer alto demais você sempre pode esperar uma promoção ou comprar a coleção completa de Half-Life.

Diga se a review foi útil ou não, e se não foi, comente por que. Eu Agradeço.
 
LP
277 produits enregistrés

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 janvier 2018
Produit reçu gratuitement

Volvemos a Black Mesa durante el accidente sucedido en el Half Life original, pero esta vez desde otra perspectiva, la de los militares que acuden a contener y acabar ♥♥♥ las pruebas de lo que allí ha ocurrido.
Encarnaremos al cabo Adrian Shepard, miembro de los marines y que es desplegado junto ♥♥♥ su unidad como refuerzo a los militares que ya se encuentran en Black Mesa.
Mientras nos dirigimos en helicóptero a la zona de despliegue somos derribados y nos quedamos inconscientes, para despertar en los laboratorios donde nosotros y varios de nuestros compañeros ya están siendo ayudados por los científicos (como las unidades no recibían las ordenes de acabar ♥♥♥ todo el personal de Black Mesa hasta llegar a la zona de despliegue, los que nos encontramos desconocen que deban matarlos, y por tanto colaboramos ♥♥♥ ellos).
A partir de aquí ya sabéis lo que toca, luchar por sobrevivir contra nuestros enemigos, principalmente los comandos negros (un gran numero de ellos) y alienigenas (los ya vistos en el juego original + una nueva raza mas conocida como raza X) utilizando un amplio arsenal entre el que se encuentran armas ya vistas anteriormente, ademas de una arma experimental y varias alienígenas.
Resumiendo: Nuevas armas, nuevos enemigos, nuevas zonas de Black Mesa a explorar (mas algunas por las que ya pasó Gordon solo que en peor estado), Algún cruce ♥♥♥ el propio Gordon Freeman, y la presencia del misterioso administrador o G-Man.
 
Big.ϟ
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juillet 2013
Half-Life: Opposing Force is an awesome content extension in regards to the original Half-Life following a new character’s perspective going through new areas of Black Mesa dealing with new enemies, new weapons, and new bosses. Pretty fun, not that long but, not as short and ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ as Blue Shift. Worth getting if you like the original game.

+An additional story to Half-Life following one of the marine’s POV going through new maps of Black Mesa
+Not incredibly short like Blue Shift but not that long either just a nice sweet game
+Great ost
+New weapons
+New enemies
+New bosses
+Lots of new environmental dangers and new rope climbing physics
+New kind of allies
+Multiplayer ig…
+Cheats
+Cool tutorial

-Multiplayer is dead af as you can expect for a 20+ game. No real point of even trying to play as the majority of the servers are empty and usually only have 5 people or less online at once only for them to all be in a private server or in a server with bots and you can’t tell the difference between the 2.
-Game has the same mouse glitch as Blue Shift where it keeps locking to a fixated position again and again. Enabling input mouse raw some ♥♥♥♥ idk fixes this.
-The initial room in the observation deck with the giant green claw alien where you have to use the barnacle weapon to traverse into an elevated room was without a doubt so annoying. The game never explains or seems as if to show you that you can latch onto green glowing balls on the wall with the barnacle leaving you confused on what to do.
-Remote play? I don’t understand how all the original Half-Life games have a remote play option when there is no split screen whatsoever. ♥♥♥♥ ain’t gonna work.

Opposing Force is a really fun new continuation
to the Black Mesa incident with all kinds of new levels, aliens, soldiers, and very cool new weapons. Lots of fun totally worth it just some minor glitches and a dead multiplayer. Still awesome very yes don’t get Blue Shift lol.
 
reii

Küçüklüğümden beri kahramanım olan Adrian Shephard ile bir oyun mükemmelden daha öte.Half Life 1'in yanı sıra Opposing Force'da 1'den 7'ye kadar silah barı ekleniyor ve yeni silahlar ile tanışıyorsunuz.Yeni hikaye ile birlikte Gordon Freeman ve başımızın belası G-man'i tekrar görüyorsunuz.Oyunun en iyi yanı ise değişik yaratıklarlar sizin peşinizi bırakmıyor.Değişik bosslar ile dövüşmek ve onları yok etmek için yapmanız gereken şeyler oyunu daha eğlenceli kılıyor.Her ne kadar günümüzden baya eski bir oyun olursa olsun şans verilmesi gereken bir oyun.

Opposing Force je skvělým datadiskem pro skvělý Half-Life. Odehrává se ve stejném časovém období kde Gordon bojoval v Black Mesa. Hrajete za člena vojenské čistící jednotky konkrétně za desátníka Adriana Sheparda. Hra obsahuje nové zbraně a novej exemplář nepřátel takže kdo si zahraje neprohloupí.

823 produits enregistrés
5
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
7.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 juillet 2022
Akıcı Bir Zıt Deneyim!
Oyuna Onbaşı Adrian Shephard olarak bir helikopterin içinde başlıyoruz. Bu macerada bu kez Gordon Freeman'a zıt tarafta yer alıyoruz. Amacımız onu bulup durdurmak. Oyunda onu bir sahnede görüyoruz. G-Man ise arada bir karşımıza çıkıyor. Bu arada Gordon Freeman'ı oyunun sonunda durduramıyoruz ki bunu beklemiyordum ben de zaten. Blue Shift oyununun aksine bu oyunda hissizlik yok. Yani düşman canlılarla savaşırken asker olduğumuz hissi geçiyor bize gayet de bu oyunda. 7,2 saatte bitirmemin sebebi bulmacalar haricinde zorlanmam. Yeni yaratıklar eklenmiş ve bunlar beni gerçekten zorladı. Bölümlerde ne yapmam gerektiğini anlamadığım ve çözümlere baktığım zamanlar oldu. Fakat Blue Shift'teki kadar hüsrana uğramadım bulmacaları ve çözümlerini görünce. Bu açıdan buradaki bulmacaları daha çok beğendim ve daha mantıklı olduklarını düşünüyorum. Hem de bir oraya bir buraya koşuşturmaca daha az var.

Oyuna yeni silahlar da eklenmiş ve bunları kullanmak gerçekten keyifli. Bunun yanında fenerimiz yerine yeşil gösteren gözlük eklenmiş: Sanırım bu, gece görüş gözlüğü olsa gerek. Şarjlı tabii ki. İpe de tırmanabiliyoruz çeşitli yerlerde. Hatta tırmanmamız gerekiyor.

Oyunun sonu beklediğim gibi bitmedi - Oyunun sonunda Gordon'ın çabalamaya devam ettiği bir sahne konulabilirdi. - ama oyunun başarılı olduğunu düşünüyorum. Ben beğendim genel olarak.

Şimdi bu oyunda hata var mı? Evet, var. Hemen hataların çözümüne geçelim: İlk hata olan fare hareketinde bozulmayı çözebilmek için Options seçeneğinden Raw Mouse Input kutucuğunu işaretlemeniz gerekiyor. Mouse Sensivity ayarını da ben 6.0 yapmıştım, daha normal oluyor oynanış. İkinci hata olan oyun içi yükleme kısımlarında bizi bekletiyor oyun fakat beklettikten sonra oyun devam edince hareket edemiyoruz. Bunun çözümü de yükleme kısımları gelmeden önce sürekli zıplamak. Bunu yaparsanız beklettikten sonra hareket edebiliyorsunuz.

Blue Shift'i oynadıktan sonra bu çok iyi geldi, seviye atladım gibi hissediyorum. O neydi öyle ya? Tamam, bunda da hatalar var da bunlar, oyunun güzelliğinden dolayı çok göze batmıyor. Ayrıca alt yazı da yok, Türkçe dil desteği de yok. Bunu da söyleyeyim şimdiden. Sadece seslendirme var İngilizce olarak. Bu açıdan zorluk yaşatabiliyor.

Half-Life 1 Anthology isimli paketle satın almanızı öneririm bu oyunu.

Her oyunu çıktığı zamana göre değerlendirmem gerekirse benim bu oyuna puanım 7/10'dur. Half Life evrenine hiç başlamadıysanız bile denenebilir. Oynamaya değer.
 
Müzikalite

По новой

Под другим углом со стороны спецназовца Шепарда.
Больше пушек, да и верёвки могут быть применены.
Из недочётов подчеркну, что не всегда запускается,
И процесс игры может существовать без корня "hl.exe",
И сразу не поймёшь почему ты в игре, но игры нету.
В остальном всё весьма не плохо, советую поиграть
 
wetpaz
483 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 septembre 2018
A long, long time ago, in the splendid days of yore, there was a thing called an expansion pack. This might seem odd, but these expansion packs usually packed a full new single-player campaign as well as multiplayer maps and other little extras. That was way back when, in the days of CRTs, dial-up internet connections. Back when the kids would go outside and play for hours without carrying any communications devices, a time of 3DFX and Nintendo 64, a time when Gearbox released great games inspired by Aliens and Predator.

Man, how I miss those days, but thankfully Opposing Force is here to remind us of a humbler gaming industry when content reigned over pretty much everything else, games came in embossed cardboard boxes as big as your head and ran off CDs. Yes, CDs. You see, back then these expansions would be priced at around 40$ a piece so they pretty much had to justify that price tag.

Lo and behold, Opposing Force came with around a dozen new maps for multiplayer, new multiplayer modes including CTF and a 7-9 hour single-player campaign. Compare that to that today's micro-DLC and lootbox bullcrap and you'll see how great those days were.

As for Opposing Force? It's quite possibly the best FPS expansion pack of all time. New enemies, new weapons, new levels and they all feel every bit as natural as anything that came in Half-Life. You even get to watch Freeman jump into the portal in the Lambda complex. How's that for awesome?

If you were gaming around when this was released, buy it for the sake of nostalgia. If you weren't, buy it so you can see how consumer friendly and inspred game developers were back in the late 90s and early naughties. Either way, you won't be disappointed.
 
AssKicker47
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Half-Life: Opposing Force

☑ Casual players
☐ Hardcore players

☐ Everyone

☐ Bad

☐ Really bad

☐ Masterpiece

☐ Easy Peasy
☐ Easy to learn but hard to master
☑ Medium

☐ Really short ( 0 - 2 hours)
☑ Short ( 2 - 8 hours)
☐ Average ( 8 - 12 hours)
☐ Long ( 12+ hours)
☐ Endless

☐ Full price

☐ Free


--- [Bugs] ---
☐ Game itself is a bug
☐ Lot of bugs
☑ Few Bugs (Need to crouch and jump to get on some platforms when it wasn't necessary)
☐ Nothing

Gameplay
this game is an expansion pack for Half-Life, Opposing Force is a first-person shooter. The overall gameplay of Opposing Force does not significantly differ from that of Half-Life. Players are required to navigate through the game's levels, fight hostile non-player characters and solve a variety of puzzles to advance.

Review
What I like about this DLC the most is it's in the same timeframe as the orginal Half-Life and they managed to keep the same playing style. Very enjoyable just like Half-Life has always been.

Find Gordon Freeman 8.5/10
 
Rapid Shadow

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
14.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 juin 2022
My previous review was rather negative, but after a second playthrough, nah man, this expansion's pretty good. I'm gonna use this review as a chance to confront my old one and see where I was wrong.

- "New enemy types are obnoxious bullet sponges in all the moments you want them not to be." Nah dude, just do what you did with HL1 and figure out what guns go well against what enemies.
- "The handheld barnacle barely gets any use" Okay, still true, but it lets you skip one of the least interesting chapters very easily. That's worth plenty in redeeming it.
- "It's easy to miss certain new weapons entirely with how out of your way you have to go to find them." Nope, I literally just played a section wrong. You have to deactivate that electric fence while getting the Desert Eagle (your first gun!!), not damage boost through it. I also think I did in fact get the Spore Launcher and just forgot about it entirely somehow.
- "The boss fight at the end plays like a Mario or Zelda boss--read into that what you will." Okay, still true, but Idk why I ever tried to paint this negatively. I love Mario and Zelda, dude. It just clashes a bit in a boomer shooter, perhaps.
- "What a dated notion, by the way, that G-Man needs to minimize witnesses as though his employers were the US government--clashes a bit with the enigmatic endgame of galactic proportions he clearly attends to from HL2 onwards, don't you think?" Also still true, but everyone knows by now not to think too hard about the canonicity of the expansions. With the exception of Blue Shift, you probably aren't playing them for story anyway.
- "Opposing Force emphasizes combat over puzzle-solving, and is less forgiving with ammo and recovery." I found on replay that it's actually fair enough with ammo and recovery, as long as you're smart with your use of them. And the combat's fun! Why complain?

Additional points that have helped turn me around on Op4:
-This expansion's take on an On A Rail section is far shorter and less convoluted than HL1's. So, you know, it's better.
-Unlike HL1 or the HL2 saga, you never lose your arsenal. Which is great, because it's kind of a way better arsenal than Gordon's.
-Your squadmates aren't necessarily that smart and it can feel like they're slowing you down. This is a good thing in disguise because killing them is a good source of ammo (or even an early M249) if you're in a pinch and removes the headache!
-Look Adrian, ropes! We can use these for big pits.

Lessons to be learned: Consider playing it on Easy first. Going in gung-ho into Normal difficulty without at least doing the Boot Camp first wasn't smart. Pace yourself with it, too--5 hours straight of combat-centric Half-Life is easy to feel burnout from afterwards.

I misjudged you, Opposing Force. You're the best expansion. You're even better than HL2 Episode One. And that's mainline!
 
AndrewNebz

A great expansion to Half-Life. I enjoyed playing from the perspective of one of the soldiers (Adrian Shepard) and what he went through in order to survive Black Mesa! The game itself, well, just like Half-Life, it has a good combination of puzzles, weapons, combat and story telling. This expansion is definitely worth the buy (even at $4.99) to continue enjoying the amazing Half-Life series.

Recommandé
18.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 janvier 2014
Half Lifeの追加エピソードという扱いの独立したゲーム
なのでHL1は必要ありませんが話は関連しているので本編をクリア後にプレイする方がいいです。
このゲームに関してはシステムはHL1と同じなので大した変更はありませんが、ユニークな武器や新たにロープが追加されたりしました。
特に後半でバーナクルが武器になるというのはとても面白いアイディアと思いました。
ストーリーとしてはとても魅力的でHLで登場した海兵隊の一員としてブラックメサの事件鎮圧に出撃します。
主人公は軍人なのでプレイしている感覚は特別SFチックなところはありません。
強いて言うなら敵がエイリアンというところだけです。
HL本編が気に入ったという方はとてもおすすめできる作品です。
 
akaba_in_end

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Recommandé
Évaluation publiée le 28 février 2011
Opposing Force is very enjoyable to play after Half-Life. It's neat to see more of what's going on at Black Mesa while Gordon Freeman is running loose.

Opposing Force retains the polish of the original Half-Life. It doesn't tell the same great story, but the puzzles are strong and it fleshes out the original nicely.

Сказ о том,как солдатики Американские прилетели Фримана убивать да Мезу Чёрную от ученых отчищать.Но солдатики не знали что силушкой мерятся придется с инопланетянами.Оказалось Фримен герой,инопланетян монтировкой раскидывал направо и налево,которые оказались лишь авангардом,а нашим бравым солдатикам нужно было биться с более сильным противником которого сам Фримен ещё не видал.Вам как Адриану Шепарду (ШЕПАРДУ!?MASS DEFFECT FAN TRIGGERED(Ибо с шедевром Биоваров я познакомился,к сожалению,раньше чем с этой игрой)) придется попотеть похлеще чем Фримену,ибо тут настоящая война,а не те исследовательские игрушки что были у героя со знаком Лямбда

Évaluation publiée le 20 octobre 2017
Another perspective of one the greatest playable innovations of all time, containing just as much play time as the first game. Play as the very people sent in to hunt down Gordon Freeman. With more weapons, enemies, and areas to play through, it gives more lore and playability to a great franchise.

9.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 décembre 2018
En düşük sistemlerde bile çalışabilir. Oynanış açısından çok çok yeterli. 2019'a yaklaştığımız bugünlerde bile çok keyifli. Çıktığı döneme göre Valve harika bir iş başarmış.

İlk Half Life oyununa göre Opposing Force daha iyileştirilmiş durumda. Silahlar daha iyi durumda. Buglar azalmış. Oyun senaryosu akıcı. Butonlar daha sorunsuz çalışıyor. Tabi oyunda eleştirilecek çok fazla şey var ama çıktığı yılı düşününce bunların hiçbir önemi yok. Beğendim, öneriyorum :) Oyun 3-4 saatlik bir sürede bitirilebilir.

Online > Half Life kadar olmasada hala açık online serverlar var. Arkadaşlarınızla güzel vakit geçirebilirsiniz.

Recommandé
5.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juillet 2017
Great and hard Half-Life expansion. Includes New weapons like sniper rifle, wrench, gross "grappling hook", alien taser, Desert Eagle, "green balls" launcher, machine gun striaght out of movie Rambo or a device, which take you to the Xen right away. You're controlling Shephard. No, not Commander Shephard, Adrian Shephard - US Marine Corporal. You're seeing Half-life from the soldier's perspective. From start to finish - real interesting experience.

Hold on....
Living Multiplayer? From the DLC from 1999? That's really neat...
No more COD, time for Opposing Force!

Personally one of the best DLC I've ever played.
 
MyKeY

1
Recommandé
11.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 janvier
Любишь кататься – люби и саночки возить. Прошел первый Half-Life – пройди и все DLC к нему

Сомневаюсь, что в 2023 будут люди, читающие отзыв DLС от игры 1998 года, но мое отношение к нему, такое же, как и к оригиналу. Шикарная игра, но своего времени. Хотите сюжет узнать, прочитайте эти 2 строчки в интернете, хотите пробежать, поностальгировать или посмотреть, как было раньше? Будет достаточно и оригинальной части.
По качеству DLC на уровне с оригиналом, только короче и позволяет посмотреть на сюжет с другой стороны баррикад, а именно в качестве спецназовца, которому надлежит устранить Гордона Фримена. Закрыл гештальт, к первой части серии более не вернусь. Она как доисторическая картина – руками лучше не трогать.
P.s. Олег привет!
 
Stinger
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 novembre 2021
Half-Life: Opposing Force... Underrated kavramının sözlük karşılığı.

Half-Life evreninde üzüldüğüm isimlerdendir Adrian Shephard.
Hikayemiz Half-Life 1 ile paralel bir şekilde geçmektedir. Black Mesa da kaza oluyor ve Xen gezegeni ile Dünya arasında portal açılıyor. bizde uçakla Black Mesa'ya giderken Xen gezegenindeki uzaylılar uçağımızı patlatmasıyla başlıyor. Asker olarak amacımız Black Mesa kazasına şahit olan herkesi susturmak ve Gordon Freeman'i öldürmektir.

Oyun gerçekten hikaye ilerleyişiyle, atmosferiyle bir "yan oyuna" göre mükemmel işlenmiş. İnsanın üzüldüğü konu da bu tam olarak. Bu oyun bittikten sonra hiçbir Half-Life evreninde bir daha bahsedilmedi. Gabe eğer Half-Life 3'de Adrian Shephard'a yer vermezsen ölene dek affetmicem seni.


- TEORİ (SPOILER) -
-
-
G-Man'in Finalde Adrian Shephard'ı uzayda ölümle baş başa bırakmadan önce söylediği bir cümle çok dikkatimi çekti ve G-Man'in aslında Gordan Freeman olma olasılığını arttırdı kafamda:
- İtiraf ediyorum, Her türlü koşula uyum sağlayan ve hayatta kalanlara karşı ayrı bir saygım vardır. Bu bana kendimi hatırlatıyor...

Bu cümlede aslında Freeman'in ilk başlarda normal birisi olduğunu kazadan sonra ise yaşadığı olaylar yüzünden değiştiğini ve her türlü koşula ayak uydurduğunu ve ilerde G-man olup zamana hükmedeceğini düşünüyorum. Half-Life 3 son oyun olur büyük ihtimalle ve G-man ile Gordon Freeman'in bağlantısını görürüz.
 
Jirentix
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
